fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update 25-Feb-2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you everyone for your reports around the Loom Chrome extension causing your Confluence page to freeze. After assessing this bug, we have narrowed the cause to to changes on Loom's side. We have reached out to Loom and are working with them on a long term solution. 

In the mean time, Loom is working to disable the extension for the Atlassian domain to fix the breakage. You are also welcomed to temporarily disable the Loom extension and restart your browser. 

We will be moving this bug to Medium priority as we await Loom's updates for a fix. 

Best,
Sunny
{panel}
h3.  
h3. Issue Summary

Loom - video recorder extension in Chrome will cause the page to freeze when using Confluence
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Loom - Loom - video recorder for Google Chrome
 # Restart browser
 # Edit any page
 # Try to align the text on the page or edit the text;

h3. Expected Results
 - Loom - video recorder in Chrome should not cause the page to freeze

h3. Actual Results
 - Loom - video recorder extension in Chrome is causing the page to freeze

h3. Workaround
 - Disable temporarily the Loom extension, restart the browser and then use Confluence Cloud
fields.summary: Loom - video recorder extension in Chrome is causing the page to freeze
Provide Admins with ability to rename deleted users or change page's ownership

fields.description:
h3. Description
* Users were previously able to drag & drop macros on the old editor, such as the Info macro, Panel macro, Status macro, etc.

h3. Current situation & Suggestion
* Users should be able to drag & drop macros across the page, to provide them with a seamless editing experience; 
* This would allow users to modify their page's structure even after the page is complete or even while editing
fields.summary: Drag & drop functionality for macros in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user tried to create multiple Jira issues from a table, the value selected for the Issue Summary is not respected. It will display as if we are counting summary=n-1.
 Example:
||Value-00||Value-01||
|Col A1|Col A2|

If we *select the column named Value-00*, the value used for the summary will be the *number designated to each row.*
 If we *select the column named Value-01*, the value used for the summary will be the *value under the column under Value-00.*
 It seems that the feature considers the number column as a live column instead of a simple row counter.

 

Example .GIF:

*Without Numbered Column (Works as expected)*

!IssueWithNoNumberedRow.gif!

 

*With Numbered column (does not work as expected)*

!IssuesWithNumberedRow.gif!

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new table in any Confluence page that uses the Fabric Editor
 # Under table options, select *Numbered Column*
 # Publish the page
 # Select the value from the first column and first row
 # Click to *Create multiple issues from table*

h3. Expected Results

The value used for issue Summary corresponds to the values under the selected column.
h3. Actual Results

The value used for the issue Summary is always the previous column.
h3. Workaround
 # Edit the page
 # Deselect the numbered column option under table options
 # Create the issues
 # Edit the page again
 # Select the numbered column option
fields.summary: Creating multiple issues from table with numbered rows uses incorrect Issue Summary value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a page has a lot of tables, links and status macros content the input lag becomes noticeable. Typing a sentence can take seconds or tens of seconds to actually render in the editor.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a few hundred tables, links and macros to a confluence page

h3. Expected Results
* No input lag when typing from keyboard

h3. Actual Results
* There's a noticeable lag after each key press

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Text input on a Confluence page is very slow

fields.description:
Recently Atlassian enabled 2FA for domain accounts which is a good first step...however you've only addressed half the problem.

What about all the accounts on a domain we don't manage?

As an IT Administrator for my organisation, I want to force ALL users to have 2FA enabled if they plan to access our sites. So I would like to see a setting added to Jira, Confluence, etc which is:
 * Force non-domain accounts to have 2FA enabled

Until they setup 2FA on their Atlassian account, they can't access our site.
fields.summary: Force non-domain accounts to enable 2FA before they can access your account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While creating new templates, the page width for the template can't be changed. It only provides a narrow view option.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to settings
# Go to Global templates and blue prints
# Add a new template. 
# Try to expand the width of the page

h3. Expected Results
There's an expand icon at the top right corner of the editor

h3. Actual Results
No expand icon present

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create template page width can't change

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Spaces List macro is not responding to changes on its options while viewing the page and it's also returning a "Page Not Found" when clicking through its options on the preview window, while editing it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and insert the Spaces List macro
 # Try to navigate through the macro's tabs

h3. Expected Results

It should display the correct information based on the tab selected
h3. Actual Results

The page just refreshes when selecting a different tab or even throws a "Page Not Found" error
h3. Workaround

You can use the [Content by Label macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-content-by-label-macro/] as a workaround to display only the spaces you want:
 # Edit their homepage;
 # On the top-right corner, click over the ellipses;
 # Click on *Add label* and create a new label (or add an existing one) called "_test_", for example;
 # Make sure to remove the "_Home_" word from the page's title (otherwise it will be displayed in the future);
 # Go the page you were trying to add the Spaces List macro and add the Content by Label one;
 # In the macro settings, insert the label you just added to the spaces' overview pages.
fields.summary: Spaces List macro is not working properly

fields.description:
Hello

 

I suggest "indentation feature" on confluence task list.

 

A task sometimes includes many sub-tasks. But, new confluence editor cannot organize many subtasks with indentations. Tab key is not working on the task lists.

 

So, I want an enhancement to insert indentations(with tab key) on task lists like below. This will help organize tasks briefly.

 

[   ] Task A

    [   ] SubTask A-1

    [   ] SubTask A-2

[   ] Task B

    [   ] SubTask B-1

 

Best Regards,

Darren
fields.summary: Task list indentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attaching an image in below comment section will display the image in full page width by default

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and publish
# From the comment section below the page, add a comment and include an image without resizing
# Save comment

h3. Expected Results
Image is shown as the fixed width as the source image
 !Screenshot 2020-01-17 at 3.07.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Image is being displayed in full width
 !Screenshot 2020-01-17 at 3.05.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
resize the image before saving the comment

h3. Notes
There is no method to have the image to go back to full width without re-uploading/attach them.
fields.summary: Attaching an image on comment below the page will default in full page width

fields.description: see [https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/browse/PIR-3388]
fields.summary: PIR-3388 corrective action. Add monitoring for error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In instances that still have the legacy editor to edit custom templates (blueprint), if we try to create a page with that template, the page will be empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new template (either global or from a space) on the legacy editor 
# Insert some content on the template and save it
# Try to create a page with that template

h3. Expected Results
The page should contain the template's data

h3. Actual Results
The page is empty

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Templates using the legacy editor are creating empty pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When placing a page properties report macro on the same page as a task report macro, if the task report macro returns user mentions, then the page properties report macro will cause the text to display nearly completely vertically.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Create some pages with page properties (you may want to include at least some user mentions as my tests did) and provide those pages with a label
 # Step 2: on your main test page, create a page properties macro that pulls in your pages that you made in step one.
 # Step 3: on some pages,  (you can use the pages from step 1) place some tasks and ensure that they have user mentions (you may want to also have text as my tests did as well)
 # Step 4: Place a task report macro on the main testing page and ensure that your tasks you made in the previous step are brought into the result
 # Step 5. You may already see the issue. If you do not, be sure to disabled cache for your browser, then hard-reload the page to ensure the CSS styles are updated.

h3. Expected Results
Both macros display normally.

h3. Actual Results

The style of the page properties report macro will be incorrect causing the text to break on most, if not all, letters in the page titles and other aspects.

*Notes*

- This issue does not seem to impact Edge/IE.
- This issue only occurs only if the tasks in your task report have user mentions.
- This issue will persist after editing the page to no longer contain the task report macro until you hard-refresh the page. Disabling cache may also be required to force the style to update in the browser.

h3. Workaround

There is no known workaround other than to ensure that the two macros are not present on the same page.
fields.summary: Placing both a page properties report macro and a task report macro on the same page causes the formatting of the page properties report macro to style incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Copying numbers from excel and pasting into Confluence's tables messes up data and end up converting decimal numbers into numbered headings;

* E.g. Copying this next table from Excel and pasting into Confluence's table
|1|
|2|
|3|
|4|
|0.1|
|5|
* New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy some values from Excel (e.g. paste the table above into Excel), specially ones containing decimals;
# Copy & Paste these values into a table in Confluence;

h3. Expected Results
* Copied values should be exactly like in Excel;

h3. Actual Results
* Values are pasted into Confluence and are formatted like a numbered list, converting the decimals from 0.1, for example, to 1.1

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copying numbers from Excel and pasting into Confluence's tables messes up data.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The file viewer on the new editor does not show a tooltip when hovered over

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Confluence page created with the new editor
# Add an attachment to the page
# Click the attachment to view it
# Hover over the tool icons

h3. Expected Results
A tooltip shows describing the tool
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 14.15.11.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
No tooltip is shown
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 14.15.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New editor file viewer does not show tool tip

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Static content macros are called twice when the page is rendered.

This can lead to the following error being displayed to the end-users:
{quote}There were errors rendering the macro:
- An unknown error occurred{quote}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add any static content macro on the page
 ## This might need to be a macro that you have access to the logs of
 # Save the page, and view the page.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should make a call to the remote server to render the static content macro only once
h3. Actual Results

Confluence does 2 same calls to the remote server to render the static content macro
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Static content macros are called twice when the page is rendered

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Currently, bottom comments don't provide us with an option to add the *Tasks* macro. It would be nice to have the *Tasks* macro available for comments, so we could address tasks to other people when the subject cannot be added to the page.

Hence, the *Task Report* macro would have an option to get tasks from comments per page.
fields.summary: Tasks in comments

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When creating a global or space template in Confluence, there is no ability to save the template as a draft.

In addition, templates can't rely on Synchrony to automatically save a draft, so if someone navigates away from a draft they were working on, it will be lost forever.

Drafts that are saved are then public and ready to use, but there's no way to mark it as a draft if it's not ready to be used.

h4. Suggestion
# Automatically create a draft when editing or creating a template.
# Provide ability to "Save as draft..." or to mark an existing template as a draft
# Provide some sort of notification if a user is about to navigate away from a drafted template and has not saved it yet.

Template drafts can be lost easily, for example, If someone uses *Preview* to review their template and clicks the back button in their browser instead of clicking *Edit* again. There's no warning at all and work will be lost.
fields.summary: Ability to save templates as drafts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary On the old editor, on every internet page, selecting all of its content (*CTRL + A* / *CMMD + A*) and copying it (*CTRL + C* / *CMMD + C*), was possible to let you paste it (*CTRL + V* / *CMMD + V*) into the page. For some reason, the new editor doesn't always work when we are pasting content we used to select all on webpages. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new page; # Here you may have to search for a page that won't let you copy the content, as [this one|https://www.businessinsider.com/infographic-5-factors-transforming-payments-experience], for example; # Select all the content in the page with the keyboard shortcut (*CTRL + A* / *CMMD + A*); # Copy the content (*CTRL + V* / *CMMD + V*); # Paste it into the Confluence draft page (*CTRL + V* / *CMMD + V*) h3. Expected Results The content is pasted on the page. h3. Actual Results Nothing happens. *Notes*: * Copying only the real content in the page (the article itself) works; * On this webpage, after you try to include on your select the {{*
*}} tag it has right after the end of the content, the pasting action stops to work; * The piece of content that is impacting it to work here is: {code:html}
Follow us on:
Download on the App Store
Get it on Google Play
Also check out:
{code} * Trying to follow the code, after pasting the content nothing happens and it returns a index.js h3. Workaround When this happens, you can paste the content on an external text editor (like Word, for example), then copy it and paste it on Confluence.
fields.summary: Selecting all, copying and pasting content from external websites doesn't paste the content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using some profile languages will cause the epic link column in the table generated by the Jira Issue macro to be blank.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your profile language to any language not being English (I.E. Deutsch, Norsk, Русский, Spanish, Portuguese)
# Insert a Jira issue macro (table) and include Epic link field
# View the Jira issue macro table

h3. Expected Results
Epic link should show if it was added to show in the Jira Issue macro table. 

h3. Actual Results
Epic link is not showing if it was added to show in the Jira Issue macro table. 

h3. Workaround
- Change the Profile language to English.
fields.summary: Unable to view epic link in Jira Issue macro table if the profile language is set to languages other than English

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the Confluence pages are linked from *Jira* end, then the Jira links button on the top of the Confluence page doesn't render the Jira Issue details while switching to pages. It will only render the details upon page refresh.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# From *Jira* end, select the issue and choose *Link Page* option. 
# Follow this step 1, for two or three issues.
# In Confluence, create multiple pages and see if the *Jira link* button appears on top of the page.
# Try switching amongst different pages, the issues will not be rendered. 

h3. Expected Results
The Jira links should render the Jira Issues while switching through Confluence pages.

h3. Actual Results
The links won't render the Jira Issues. Please refer below screenshot:
!Screen Shot 2020-01-15 at 3.02.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Refresh the pages and the Jira Issues will be visible: 
!Screen Shot 2020-01-15 at 3.04.01 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira links button on top of the Confluence page doesn't render unless the page is refreshed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Links to Jira issue are not rendered in Confluence comments

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Confluence page
# Paste a URL of a Jira issue that is from a linked instance in the comment window

h3. Expected Results
The Jira issue URL will rendered with the issue type icon and summary text

h3. Actual Results
The Jira issue URL won't be rendered and it just shows the URL
 
h3. Workaround
There is no workarounds found at the moment

h3. Note
The rendering is working as expected in the page itself
 !スクリーンショット 2020-01-15 15.48.15.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Jira issue URL is not rendered in Confluence comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Installing PDF Export Language Support on windows device does not work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to https://<site>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/flyingpdf/configurepdflanguagesupport.action
# Install a language like Songti.ttc


h3. Expected Results
Installation success

h3. Actual Results
Error returned
 !image (3).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Access the site on a macbook and install the language
fields.summary: Installing PDF Export Language Support on windows fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When exporting certain pages that contains image and text in a separate line to PDF, the text flows around the image

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# The exact steps to reproduce this page undefined. For the affected pages, the image and the text are in different lines when published, however, when selecting the three-dot icon > "View Source", the text is flowing around the image
# Export the page to pdf

h3. Expected Results
The image and the text are in separate lines

h3. Actual Results
The text flows around the image
 
h3. Workaround
# Create a new page and open the editor
# In another tab, navigate to the affected page
# Press ctrl+a to copy all the contents
# Paste it to 1 and publish
fields.summary: When exporting certain pages that contains image and text in a separate line to PDF, the text flows around the image

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the legacy editor, when using the Jira Issue/Filter macro to list some issues using table view, the issue's descriptions won't be wrapped.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue on Jira with a long unified string on the description
# Create a page on the legacy editor and create a Jira Issue/Filter macro
# Set the JQL to look for issues from that project and insert the macro
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The Jira Issue/Filter macro should wrap the text

h3. Actual Results
Jira Issue/Filter macro doesn't wrap the text

h3. Workaround
Recreate the page using the new editor.
fields.summary: Jira Issue/Filter macro doesn't wrap text in table view on the legacy editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a table is copied & pasted, the alignment information of all text in the cells is lost and the text in the pasted table is all left-aligned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table with three cells.
 # Add a text on each cell, like "Left", "Center" and "Right".
 # Change the alignment for each word.
 # Copy the entire table with ctrl+c.
 # Paste the table somewhere else on the page with ctrl+v.

h3. Expected Results

It will paste the table respecting the text alignment.
h3. Actual Results

The text for all cells will be aligned to the left.

!Screen Recording 2020-01-14 at 04.34 PM.gif|width=452,height=376!
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Text alignment is lost when copy/pasting a table

fields.description:
With the new editor and renderer, viewing the previous versions of pages do not match the style and formatting as when those pages are/were in the published (current) state.

This means that a page can look significantly different when looking at it as when it is restored to being published.

I would like to recommend changing the style of the page previous version preview to match the style of the new renderer.
fields.summary: Page Previous Version view style does not match style of published pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we are editing a page, sometimes instead of click in the *Publish* button, we fall to click over the *Close* one, as a misclick.
There are other times when we click out of the page's body and hit the *backspace*, or misclick over the *back* button in the browser, or even swipe the trackpad with two fingers and get back to the previous screen.

h3. Suggestion
When any of the above situations happen, it would be great if Confluence provided us with a warning message saying "_you are about to leave this page_" or something related, in order to ask us if that's intentional or not.
fields.summary: Warning message when we are exiting from a draft

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When we add labels to a page, it will start showing on the dialog box and there is no option to sort it to easily check the labels.
h3. Suggestion

Add an option to sort labels alphabetically.
fields.summary: Ability to sort labels on dialog box

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With topnav, 100% iframe height doesn’t take into account the top nav height, so they’re getting double scrollbars when rendering their Scroll Document app.

[https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/sizetoparent-general-pages-have-the-wrong-height-on-cloud/34744/2]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/sizetoparent-general-pages-have-the-wrong-height-on-cloud/34744/2]

h3. Expected Results

NO double scrollbars
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: With topnav, 100% iframe height doesn’t take into account the top nav height

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a space in Confluence Cloud that contains Questions, it will result in a failure.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space in Confluence Cloud
# Subscribe to Questions for Confluence
# Create questions on the space

h3. Expected Results

Space will be deleted.

h3. Actual Results

Space fails to be deleted.

Logs:

{code}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: update or delete on table "content" violates foreign key constraint "fkpwgl85a266iie5i0adu8bdbcv" on table "usercontent_relation"
  Detail: Key (contentid)=(1017453599) is still referenced from table "usercontent_relation".
org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2497)
org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2233)
org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:310)
org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeInternal(PgStatement.java:446)
org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.execute(PgStatement.java:370)
org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeWithFlags(PgPreparedStatement.java:149)
org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PgPreparedStatement.java:124)
sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor337.invoke(Unknown Source)
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
{code}

h3. Workaround

No workarounds are available at the moment, [contact support.|https://getsupport.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Deleting a space in Confluence Cloud with Questions will result in a failure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a Page in the new editor while in full screen. The font size in Edit mode is smaller than when the page is published
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create page set to Full width with Text
 # Publish page

h3. Expected Results

Font size should remain the same
h3. Actual Results

Font Size is larger

 

*Edit Mode*:
 !Screenshot 2020-01-14 at 12.23.50.png!

*Published*:
 !Screenshot 2020-01-14 at 12.24.18.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Font size in the new editor is larger when the page is published

fields.description: Currently, users have to use the browser view when trying to add/edit tables using iOS devices. It will be great if this will be available in the iOS app.
fields.summary: Ability to add and edit tables in iOS app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Once you migrate a page from the old to the new editor, it automatically goes into narrowed width, instead of using full page width

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a full-width page in the old editor
# Migrate this page to the new editor
# Check draft or published mode

h3. Expected Results
Page should keep old editor's width (generally full-width)

h3. Actual Results
Page is actually showing as narrow-width

h3. Workaround
# Click the {{<->}} arrow in the editor's right-hand side
# Publish the page
fields.summary: New Editor Converted Pages aren't maintaining width settings
Ability to change the thumbnail video on Confluence pages

fields.description: In Confluence Cloud, allow a space administrator to set the page tree to be automatically expanded for all users (users could then collapse the page tree individually, as desired). Include options for the page level depth displayed (1st level child pages, 2nd level child pages, etc.). I understand this already exists in the Confluence Server version - why is it still not available in Confluence Cloud?
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud: Allow Space Admin to set Page Tree to open in expanded view

fields.description:
As an admin and regular editor of Confluence pages, I'd like to suggest a feature that directly links to duplicated pages when the warning prompt appears:

'A page with the title 'x' already exists in this space. Enter a different title for your page.'

If the existing page was linked to this alert, it'd make it easier and faster to track it down and avoid duplicity. 

Thanks,

Grant
fields.summary: Link to duplicated page when warning prompt appears

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When following the exact steps below, by adding a group to a page's restrictions with only "can view", the members of that group will still be able to edit the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the padlock icon;
 # Select *Viewing and editing restricted*
 # Type a group's name and select it
 # Select *Can view* and then *Add*
 # You may notice that both the current user and the group will change to *Can view* there

h3. Expected Results

Members of that group shouldn't be able to edit the page
h3. Actual Results

Members of that group are being able to edit the page
h3. Workaround

The available workaround is to recreate the restriction doing one step at a time:
 # Restrict the page and apply the restrictions;
 # Edit the restrictions again and then add the group.
fields.summary: Members of group with only "can view" restriction can still edit a page

fields.description:
Currently users can navigate from Atlassian Access to configure session duration enforcement, but evidently (per technical support), session duration enforcement is not part of Access at all.

This is confusing and should be clarified.
 # Begin on admin.atlassian.com after Access has been enabled
 # Click on the Atlassian Access logo
 # Click "<-- Back to Organization"
 # Click "Security"
 # Click "Session Duration"

This navigation path makes it seem that Atlassian Access is required to use session duration.
fields.summary: Clarifying Relationship Between Session Duration & Atlassian Access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A few days ago, we have identified a bug that was not allowing us to delete the first created space on a Confluence Cloud Free subscription. This was reported on the below bug request:
 * *CONFCLOUD-68319: Cloud Free, Unable to delete some spaces*

The above bug is now fixed for new Confluence Cloud Free subscriptions, but the existing ones where this behavior was happening are not.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

On a Confluence Cloud Free subscription, created before *Jan, 8th, 2020*, try to delete the very first space you created in the onboarding.
h3. Expected Results

You are able to delete this space.
h3. Actual Results

The space is not able to be deleted and there is no option to delete.

!image-2020-01-09-18-21-13-807.png|width=384,height=321!
h3. Workaround

A procedure that might work on this case is to upgrade your subscription to a Standard license and then downgrade it to Free again - but pay attention on this step: sometimes it doesn't work either.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud Free - cannot delete space on existing sites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user scrolls, the "Comment | Create Issue" tooltip scrolls on top of the nav instead of behind it.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View a Confluence page

 # Highlight a few words, so the tooltip pops up

 # Scroll down

h3. Expected Results

Tooltip scrolls off the page BEHIND the nav
h3. Actual Results

Tooltip is ON TOP of the nav as it scrolls
h3. Workaround

n/a
fields.summary: Comment | Create Issue" tooltip scrolls on top of the nav

fields.description:
At this time, it is possible to insert the excerpt include macro in a table cell, however, it is not possible to insert the Excerpt macro into a table. Attempting to insert the excerpt macro into a table results in the macro being inserted into the page below the table.

I would like to propose that the excerpt macro be made to be able to be nested into a table.
fields.summary: Allow excerpt macro in a table

fields.description:
We have a shared page that adds me back in as a watcher every time I edit it. It would be great to opt in/out of watching at page level (and not turn it back on unless I specifically ask it to).

You can currently switch it off for your whole account (https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/watch-pages-spaces-and-blogs-724765353.html#WatchPages,SpacesandBlogs-Autowatchandothernotificationoptions)
fields.summary: The ability to turn off 'Autowatch' at the page level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images inside the table are not getting loaded to the correct scale as to how it is showing when viewing the images in the browser. The images are bigger when viewing in a Confluence Cloud mobile app for Android. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table on a page
# Insert images to the table
# View the page in computer browser
# View the image in a Confluence Cloud mobile app for Android

h3. Expected Results
The images should be getting loaded to the correct scale as to how it is showing when viewing the images in the browser.

h3. Actual Results
The images are bigger when viewing in a Confluence Cloud mobile app for Android. 

h3. Workaround
- No workaround
fields.summary: Images not scaling correctly in Mobile app for Android

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The user is not able to see the header text from Table of Contents macro in page links when the header link is pasted in a different page

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to show the header text from Table of Contents macro in the page links when the header link is pasted in a different page

h3. Why this is important
The user should be able to see the header text from Table of Contents macro in page links when the header link is pasted in a different page
fields.summary: Ability to show the header text from Table of Contents macro in the page links when the header link is pasted in a different page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This is a feature request to include the _option_ of copying comments when using the copy page hierarchy REST API method.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use copy page hierarchy REST API method - [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/#api-api-content-id-pagehierarchy-copy-post]

h3. Expected Results

 Comments would be included.
h3. Actual Results

Comments are not included.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Copy page hierarchy API method should support copying comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inline comments that are created by anonymous users will not display their content, instead giving a red error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1. ensure anonymous users have permission to view and can post inline comments.
 # Step 2 In an incognito window, browse to a test page and apply an inline comment as an anonymous user.

h3. Expected Results

The comment is posted and the content is readable.

h3. Actual Results

The comment is posted, however, all users viewing the comment will see an error in place of the content like this:
{quote}
Something went wrong
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support and be sure to give them this code: c2gnfk.
Reload this page
{quote}
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-07 at 5.26.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the console:
{noformat}
TypeError: Cannot read property 'startsWith' of undefined
    at PeopleLink.js:17
    at h.render (SessionData.js:92)
    at Ci (react-dom.production.min.js:173)
    at Ii (react-dom.production.min.js:172)
    at Ni (react-dom.production.min.js:180)
    at Ha (react-dom.production.min.js:232)
    at Ga (react-dom.production.min.js:233)
    at Cu (react-dom.production.min.js:249)
    at Tu (react-dom.production.min.js:248)
    at Eu (react-dom.production.min.js:245)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Inline comments created by anonymous users shows error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we have templates with variables that are in the old editor, after having our site converted to the new editing experience, the variables won't come up to be set and the page is created with blank variables.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a template with variables;
# Ask to the Atlassian Cloud support to rollout your site to the new editing experience;
# After it is done, create a page with the template.

h3. Expected Results
A screen to populate the templates is prompt.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence redirects you directly to the editor.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Template variables not working after migrating to the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Both the Popular Labels and Labels List macros will include results for deleted pages. This means that labels on deleted pages will show in this macro, even if the label isn't on any active pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space (starting in a clean space makes it easier to populate the "Popular macros" table
 # On a new page, insert a Popular Labels and a Labels Page macro.
# In the settings of both macros, restrict the results to the current space key.
# Save the page.
# Create another new page, then give it a label.
# Delete the new labelled page

h3. Expected Results
The macros will not show labels that are only on deleted pages.

h3. Actual Results
The macros still show labels that are on the deleted page.

h3. Workaround
In order to remove the labels, you can [purge the pages from the space trash|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/delete-restore-or-purge-a-page-724764873.html#Delete,restore,orpurgeapage-Purgedeletedpagespurge].
fields.summary: Popular Labels and Labels List macros include labels for pages in space trash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After creating a new page from a template, tables cannot be deleted using the delete button.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using a template that includes tables (e.g. "Product requirements")
# Click on the table to show the "Table options"/trash icon dialog:
!Screen_Shot_2020-01-07_at_1_21_16_PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Click the trash can icon

h3. Expected Results
The table should be deleted.

h3. Actual Results
The table is not deleted

h3. Workaround
Once you publish the page for the first time, the tables can be deleted on subsequent edits.
fields.summary: Clicking the delete button on a table in a new template does not delete the table
Cell width and height on NavMaps macro doesn't work if we insert the "px"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Gliffy diagrams are not loading inside expend macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a page with more than 2 expend macros
 # Step 2 Add Gliffy diagrams inside expend macros
 # Step 3 Publish the page and then try to open the page in view mode
 !image-2020-01-07-21-25-11-072.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results
Gliffy diagrams should display without any issue.

h3. Actual Results
Gliffy diagrams are not displaying.

h3. Workaround
- Refresh the page.
- Change page layout and use Gliffy diagrams outside the expand macro
fields.summary: Gliffy diagram does not display inside expand macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The customers are unable to sync or compare the users present between any two groups.

 
h3. Suggested Solution

Please check feasibility for adding this feature suggestion as it would be a helpful utility from customer's perspective to sync and compare users between two groups.

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Sync and compare users between two groups

fields.description:
Currently, users are only able to export content from Confluence into a very stripped back format in Word. There are a small set of customisations available for PDF exports but none for Word.

To help make more professional-looking documentation and reduce time spent reformatting, it would be very helpful to be able to upload a Word template that can be used to format exports into a Word document. As well as the option to alter the header, footer, text format and colour.

When looking at the Atlassian documentation, some customisations were present for Word exports but not in the later versions of Confluence.
fields.summary: Personalisation / Formatting of content when exporting to Word

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attaching a file with a long name to a page, the attachment tile will cut the file's name even if there's still space for it to be fully displayed on the tile, making it difficult to differentiate files with similar names on edit mode.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Attach a file with long and similar names

h3. Expected Results

The file's name should take the entire tile's space for better User Experience.
h3. Actual Results

The file's name will be cut, even if there's still space on the tile.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachment tile doesn't use the entire space to display the attachment's name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we are using a JIRA Issue macro to, let's say, pick all the issues from a determined project, for example, these issues come with the status field filled with statuses that have different colors than the colors they are set on JIRA - though, the description is the same.
h3. Suggestion
 * Change the *Status* field on the JIRA macro to have the same standard colors as the statuses from JIRA, in order to let the information better aligned on both apps.

Below you can find how different they are:
 * In the Confluence page:
!image-2020-01-06-15-02-31-210.png|width=474,height=208!
 * In the Jira:
!image-2020-01-06-15-04-47-786.png|width=455,height=213!
fields.summary: Make JIRA issues statuses colors the same as on JIRA

fields.description: Please add an ability to insert a table to the numbered or bulleted list. I can only add a table after the list.
fields.summary: [New editor] Add ability to add table to list

fields.description: That would be great if you bring back the ability to add the *Expand* macro to the *Info Panel* macro. In the new editor, it's impossible to do that.
fields.summary: [New editor] Add ability to add Expand macro to Info Panel macro

fields.description: I've noticed that it's impossible to insert the *Expand* macro or *Panels* to the bulleted/numbered list. It's only possible to have *Expand* and *Panels* after the list.
fields.summary: [New editor] Add ability to add Expand macro or Panels inside bulleted/numbered list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Default title of the Personal space overview page shows the translation for "\{0}''s home" instead of that for "Overview". This is confirmed to happen when the global default language is set to Japanese
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/viewlanguage.action and change the global default language to "Japanese"
 # Navigate to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/spacedirectory/view.action
 # Click the upper-right button("スペースの作成") to open the create space modal
 # Select the upper-right icon to create a personal space("個人スペース")
 # Click the blue button("作成") to proceed
 # Scroll and check the page name in the "Recently updated" section

h3. Expected Results

The title of the page is the translation for "Overview"
h3. Actual Results

The title of the page is the translation of "\{0}'s home". Note that "\{0}" is used directly and no actual values(i.e. usernames) are used for the variable
 !スクリーンショット 2020-01-06 15.37.25.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Click the edit icon to update the page title. Also, change the global default language to "English (US)" to prevent this happening again
fields.summary: Default title of the Personal space overview page shows the translation for "{0}''s home" instead of that for "Overview"

fields.description:
When the Atlassian server responds to an http
request for the attachment, it sets the "content-disposition" field to
"attachment".

One possible fix would be for the server not to set this flag for HTML
attachments.
fields.summary: HTML attachment content-disposition flag

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The checkBox are invisible on Edit Global Permission Page when checked.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as admin
 # Navigate to edit Global Permissions Page.
 # Try to un-check an already provided permission. Eg try to revoke create-space permission for confluence-users group.

h3. Expected Results

1. You should be able to see check.
h3. Actual Results

The check box is invisible
h3. Workaround

To uncheck just click on the invisible area. The uncheck box will be visible.
fields.summary: Invisible CheckBox on EditGlobalPermission Page On Mozilla Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some customers are not being able to copy pages on Confluence Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From the ••• menu, click on the Copy button;
 # Notice that the copy will fail

h3. Expected Results

The copy of the page should open in the edit mode
h3. Actual Results

The copy is failing and the following error messages are showing up for customers: 
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-03 at 10.22.19 AM.png|width=476,height=213! !image (2).png|width=404,height=264!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not able to copy pages on Confluence Cloud
PDF macro does not work on mobile APP

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to copy a page with 20+ attachments in the New Editor, it either gets timeout in Chrome or a *copypage.action* file is downloaded in Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Navigate to a page with 20+ attachments
* Try to copy the page using the option from the drop-down list

h3. Expected Results
* The page will be copied

h3. Actual Results

{noformat}
In Chrome
The web page at https://oldeditorsite.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/copypage.action?idOfPageToCopy=1164247084&spaceKey=ASFDS might be temporarily down or it may have moved permanently to a new web address.
ERR_INVALID_RESPONSE
{noformat}


{noformat}
In Safari: copypage.action file is downloaded, instead of navigating to edit mode for the page copy.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

* Open the page
* Navigate to Page Operations (***)
* Select View Source
* Select and copy all
* Open a new page and paste the content there

OR

Delete the unwanted Attachments from the page.
fields.summary: Page Copy operation with 20+ attachment gets time out

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to copy a page with 20+ attachments in the New Editor, it either gets timeout in Chrome or a *copypage.action* file is downloaded in Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Navigate to a page with 20+ attachments
* Try to copy the page using the option from the drop-down list

h3. Expected Results
* The page will be copied

h3. Actual Results

{noformat}
In Chrome
The web page at https://oldeditorsite.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/copypage.action?idOfPageToCopy=1164247084&spaceKey=ASFDS might be temporarily down or it may have moved permanently to a new web address.
ERR_INVALID_RESPONSE
{noformat}


{noformat}
In Safari: copypage.action file is downloaded, instead of navigating to edit mode for the page copy.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

* Open the page
* Navigate to Page Operations (***)
* Select View Source
* Select and copy all
* Open a new page and paste the content there

OR

Delete the unwanted Attachments from the page.
fields.summary: Page Copy operation with 20+ attachment gets time out

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the search-bar like object next to the "ask question" button, typing in characters dynamically searches and offers suggestions of existing questions.
The autocompletion is not consistent in its behavior for two classes of issues:

1. highly similar partial string matches will suddenly no longer match questions as the substing gets closer to matching the full word. eg. Typing "integrat" will match "integration" but "integrati" (with the added 'i') will drop all matches.

2. Some queries will actually return results from the API but the UI will not display the results in the returned JSON.



h3. Steps to Reproduce
For Case 1.
- add a question with a title that contains the word "integrations" somewhere in the middle of the title.
- Try typing integrations while pausing with each letter to note the change to the status of the autocomplete

For Case 2.
- add a number of questions that each contain at least one of the words in this phrase: "is there a".
- Make a couple of questions that contain the phrase "is there a" verbatim as part of the title.
- Search that phrase stopping each letter to notate the results of each request in the developer tools under the network section. This can cause no results to show. 

h3. Expected Results
Some questions show up for hits in the autocomplete as long as partial matches actually match something

h3. Actual Results

No matches are shown sometimes.

h3. Workaround

There is no known workaround.
fields.summary: Existing Question suggestion in Questions for Confluence before asking a new question is not consistent

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

Bring back the ability to move the attachments by drag and drop its location, such as a PDF thumbnail (or any other office and image file thumbnail) on the page as it was possible in the legacy editor before, without having to delete the file and uploading again on the location/spot wanted.

h4. Workaround
# Upload the PDF (or office) file through the file and images upload;
# After the file is uploaded, still on edit mode, select the file by clicking on it;
# Copy it by cmd+c or ctrl+c and then paste it it with cmd+v or ctrl+v in the desired location of the page.
# Delete the previous attachment you copied from
# Publish the page

h4. Note
It affects all the Office files (doc, pptx, xls, etc...) and PDF files.
It is possible to drag and drop the images on the page to change its location.
fields.summary: Ability to drag and drop files like PDF to move its location on the page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

An external user management option is visible when accessing a Confluence Cloud site's Security Configuration.
 - https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/viewsecurityconfig.action
 It also contains a comment and a broken link: Disable Confluence's internal user management (for example if you've delegated user management to Jira).[More about User Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Disabling+the+Built-In+User+Management]

h3. Suggested Solution

As external user management option is a [restricted function in Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/functional-differences-in-confluence-cloud-734070955.html], it would be best to provide a warning instead of the existing comment and the broken link.
fields.summary: External user management helpful warning

fields.description:
"The default positioning of the yellow emoji technically reinforces the idea of its primacy, reasserting whiteness along with it."

[https://firstmonday.org/ojs/index.php/fm/article/view/10060/8048]
fields.summary: Make emoji available in a variety of skin colors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using livesearch macro, if you set the alignment of the macro to right using the Text alignment the search will only return the space name without the page title. Due to this setting the *Additional information* field to *None* in the Livesearch macro configuration will return blank results. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a *Livesearch macro* to a page
# Set the Alignment to Right using the Text alignment
# Set the *Additional information* field to *None*
# Try to search using the livesearch macro

h3. Expected Results
- Searching using the livesearch macro should be working even if it's set the right alignment.

h3. Actual Results
- If you set the alignment of the macro to right using the Text alignment the search will only return the space name without the page title. Due to this setting the *Additional information* field to *None* in the Livesearch macro configuration will return blank results. 

h3. Workaround
- Set the alignment of the livesearch macro to left
fields.summary: Livesearch macro with right alignment was returning blank results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users aren't able to add labels to pages containing special characters or punctuation marks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt to add a label to a page e.g www.google.com

h3. Expected Results
Label is added

h3. Actual Results
Label is not added results in an error:
{code}
GraphQL error: Unexpected HTTP status 500
{code}

 !image-2019-12-30-14-45-36-604.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. Add labels without special characters for the time being.
fields.summary: Adding label with Special Characters produces GraphQL error: Unexpected HTTP status 500

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Allow native image caption
fields.summary: Add image caption support

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Allow shift+Enter working for nodes, especially for images:
so that when cursor is next to the image and you press shift+Enter the text below should be closer to the image.
fields.summary: Can not use shift+enter when cursor is next to the node (e.g. image, panel, table etc)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A comment from an Anonymous user is showing up in the default Overview page of the *first space created * in the instance when using the Confluence mobile app for iOS. The same comment does not appear when you are seeing the same page from a web browser or using the Confluence mobile app for Android. The same behavior does not happen for the default overview page of any other space created. This only happens for the first space created in the whole instance.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the default Overview page of the first space created in the mobile app for iOS
 # Scroll down the page and notice a comment from an Anonymous user.
h3. Expected Results

No comments from Anonymous users should appear on the page, like in this example of the Android app:
 !WhatsApp Image 2019-12-26 at 17.55.14.jpeg|width=300,height=588!
h3. Actual Results

The page is showing a comment from an anonymous user in the mobile app for iOS:
 !IMG_68CA545D65E0-1.jpeg|width=350,height=600! 
h3. Workaround

The workaround available is to define another existent page as the Overview page for the space, or copy the content of the default Overview into a new page and set this new one as the Overview.
fields.summary: Comment from an Anonymous user is showing in the default Overview page when accessing it using the iOS mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It is not possible to see Draw.io diagrams on Confluence pages after inserting the file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Insert any Draw.io diagram in this page - it won't even load after inserting it;
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The Draw.io diagram is shown in the page's body.

h3. Actual Results
Only a spinner wheel keeps spinning forever and the diagram is not shown.

*Notes*
* No network error in the browser's console is shown

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Draw.io diagrams not loading on Confluence pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Fix logging of tracing which causes 500 errors
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make request to plugin
 # See unhandled rejection in Splunk

h3. Expected Results

No errors
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of null
    at secrets.reduce (/root/app/server/lib/services/util/copyWithoutSecrets.js:50:27)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: GD: Fix logging of tracing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Macros that are no longer working on the new editor  are still being listed on the macro browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or edit a page (new editor)
# Click on *+* and select *View more* to open the macro's browser
# Scroll down the list 

h3. Expected Results
Macros such as Anchor and Cheese shouldn't be listed on the new editor macro's browser

h3. Actual Results
The macros are listed but won't work.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deprecated macros are still being listed on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to select text from a single Header Row Cell does not work. We need to either select nothing or all header cells.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the Old Editor (Legacy, tinyMCE)
 # Insert a table with header row
 # Try to select the text within that header row

h3. Expected Results

Only the desired text is highlighted
h3. Actual Results

No text is highlighted or every header cell is highlighted.

 

!HeaderTextHighlightCloud.gif|width=557,height=216!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Selecting text on a table header row does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when a user creates a Personal Space, it would have the username as the space key. When the [older username structure was used|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud], creating a personal space would have its key as the username used and sometimes, the username could include a space. When this user created the personal space, the key would use the space and this makes the following message to be displayed when trying to access the pages inside the space:
{quote}
*Something went wrong.*
Refresh the page and try again. If this keeps happening, let us know using the link below.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Space with the spacekey that includes a space
# Notice that if we check Space Settings, the page is properly loaded
# Navigate to the other pages in the same space

h3. Expected Results
The page tree loads as usual

h3. Actual Results
The page tree fails to load. 

The below exception is thrown in the Developer tools:
{code}
PageTree error 
{networkError: null, graphQLErrors: Array(2)}
networkError: null
graphQLErrors: (2) [{…}, {…}]
__proto__: Object
{code}

h3. Workaround
As the spacekey cannot be changed from the UI, please open a support case with [us|https://support.atlassian.com/] and we can change the spacekey for you until a permanent fix for this bug will be deployed.

h3. Notes
This is no longer reproducible from scratch, because the username structure has changed and this avoids specific characters to be used. Previously, when the usernames were using a different structure, if the user had its username that includes a space, simply creating a personal space would trigger this issue with the current page tree structure on the sidebar.
fields.summary: Personal Space using a space does not load the page tree

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When including a page within the new Confluence editor pictures which are included in the original page are displayed in their full size. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Page 1 
# Add tables and images
# Publish page 1
# Create Page 2 
# Add Include page macro to include Page 1
# Publish the page 2

h3. Expected Results
- Pictures that are included in the original page are displayed in their full size.

h3. Actual Results
- Include page macro should respect image size from the included page

h3. Workaround
- No available workaround
fields.summary: Include page macro doesn't respect image size from the included page

fields.description:
{panel:title=Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
 At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The new search experience doesn't take account of the index language.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the Indexing Language config to CJK
 # Create 3 pages which have a title {{消費税}}, {{消去}} and {{増税対応}} accordingly.
 # Go to the old experience and search pages with a query {{消費税}}.
 # Check the search result shows the pages containing {{消費税}} in their title or content body at the top.
 ** !old-experience.png|thumbnail!
 # Go to the new experience and search pages with the same query
 # Verify the search result contains the pages which title is {{消去}} and {{増税対応}} in higher search rank
 ** !new-experience.png|thumbnail!
 ** When the number of pages increased, the search result will be useless
 ** -The exact-match operator is unavailable with the new experience neither- (CONFCLOUD-67993)

h3. Expected Results

The pages corresponding to the search query will be ranked in the top.
h3. Actual Results

Irrelevant pages are ranked in the top.
h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.

-Bookmark the old experience and use it for the search.-
 [-https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action-|https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action]

 The exact match operator is now available:

!Screen Shot 2020-08-24 at 14.51.27.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The new search experience doesn't respect Indexing Language configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the office macros (word, powerpoint, excel) can't be added to the page when selecting a file from another page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and attach a word (.doc/ .docx) file
 # Publish the page
 # Create a new page and insert the *Office Word* macro
 # Type the name of the other page and select the attached document
 # Try to preview/ save the macro

h3. Expected Results

The macro should preview the document and be added to the page
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens and the following errors are logged on the browser's console:
{code:none}
jquery.js:8274 GET https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/json/attachmentsearch.action?spaceKey=TS&title=Docum&fileTypes=doc&fileTypes=docx 404
send @ jquery.js:8274
ajax @ jquery.js:7746
l.<computed> @ jquery.js:7272
getJSON @ jquery.js:7289
f.getData @ com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:12
n.dependencyUpdated @ overrides.js:134
n @ com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:14
a.onchange @ com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:19
dispatch @ jquery.js:3364
c @ jquery.js:2973

overrides.js:74 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getCurrentTitle' of undefined
    at e.beforeParamsRetrieved (overrides.js:74)
    at Object.q [as getMacroDefinitionFromForm] (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:74)
    at Object.a.complete (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:135)
    at HTMLButtonElement.<anonymous> (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:116)
    at HTMLButtonElement._onclick (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:792)
    at HTMLButtonElement.dispatch (jquery.js:3364)
    at HTMLButtonElement.c (jquery.js:2973){code}
h3. Note
 - It is also affecting old editor

h3. Workaround

Attach the Office file to the current page and insert the macro without specifying a page name in the “Page Name” field. This will prompt the macro to look into the current page.
fields.summary: Office macros can't open files from another page on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the old editing experience, it was possible to click on the last column (I mean, in the last vertical line of the table) and drag it horizontally to raise the column's size. 

h3. Suggestion
Allow this same action on the new editing experience, aiming a better use of tables.
fields.summary: Resize last column on tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a user without Create Space global permission, and has not worked on any pages before, the Your Work page will suggest to create space. It will never work as user lacks required global permission, and the menu will show a "loading circle" indefinitely

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user a trusted user
 # Remove user from default "confluence-users" group
 # Log in as user and go to the "Your work" page (https://xxxx.atlassian.net/wiki/my/recent-work

h3. Expected Results

There should be no prompt to create space

h3. Actual Results

Option is there, but does not work (as expected)


h3. Workaround

Check with admin / site admin to grant the required Global Permission to the "trusted-users-xxxx" group.
fields.summary: Users without "create space" Global Permission should not get the prompt in "Your work"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the old editor, it's possible to set text alignment in Expand Macro. The option is grayed out in the new editor. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in the new editor
# Insert an Expand Macro
# Write in the text in the Expand macro window
# Try to change the text alignment

h3. Expected Results
- It should be possible to align text when writing in the expand macro window. 

h3. Actual Results
- The text alignment option is grayed out when using Expand macro in the new editor. 

h3. Workaround
- No available workaround as of the moment.
fields.summary: Text Alignment is disabled when writing in the Expand macro window

fields.description:
h3. *Suggestion*
Allow new line with zero space padding after pressing Shift+Enter key to minimise the gap between the lines. This is helpful especially for Image captions

h3. Actual Result
*New Editor*
 !Screenshot 2019-12-23 at 9.44.16 AM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-12-23 at 10.00.14 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result
*Old Editor*
 !Screenshot 2019-12-23 at 9.46.26 AM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-12-23 at 9.58.09 AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Enable New Line with zero Spacing

fields.description: Issue resolution proper. Improved Permformance.
fields.summary: Make changes to zip

fields.description: Changes directly to HBM object. Issue experienced in cache.
fields.summary: Make the importer the space Admin.

fields.description: Security Issue with the subject approach
fields.summary: Solution via Permission Exemption.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Jira gadget macros are displaying improperly due to a change in the url used to access them. Confluence was not updated with the new url, and the plugins were no longer listening on the old url.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Try to use the Jira sprint gadget macro in a page

h3. Expected Results
Gadget works

h3. Actual Results
Gadget returns an error or displays as a completely different gadget.

h3. Notes
Some of the errors may include:
{code}Error rendering macro 'gadget' : Error rendering gadget [ https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-gadget-sprint-health/gadgets/greenhopper-sprint-health.xml{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Agile gadget macros are not displaying properly

fields.description:
xh3. Issue Summary
Not possible to download / preview attachments in Android Mobile Confluence app
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Add an attachment (non-image/pdf) to a Confluence page
 # Step 2 Using the Confluence Cloud mobile app for Android, open the same page
# Step 3 Tap the attachment

h3. Expected Results
The attachment should open and you should have an option to preview, open it with a different app and/or save it.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not possible to download and preview attachments in Android Mobile Confluence app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a page has more than 20 images and previewing the images will get stuck and no images are loaded and it just freezes the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a page
* Add around 50 images
* Tries to Preview the images

h3. Expected Results
* All images will be loaded

h3. Actual Results
* After 3 or 4 images the previewing just stops.

h3. Workaround

Either check each image separately or add the images in the New Editor Pages.
fields.summary: Image Preview gets Stuck in Old Editor

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When doing custom export for multiple pages, all the pages are exported as 1 big zip file, which is indeed difficult to search for each page or share a required page.

h3. Proposed Solution

Ability to export multiple pages as separate files, instead of 1 zip file
fields.summary: Separate file for Custom page export

fields.description:
h3.Summary

* If a user ever logged in to a Site which has a Public Space and has logged out from the instance, and tries to access the Site URL, he/she is asked for login. Clearing Cache or Cookies doesn't help. Logging out the Atlassian Account or Incognito only shows the Public Space.  
* If someone who never accessed that site, tries to access the URL, they are redirected to the Public space, even though they are logged in to their Atlassian Account or Logged in to their regular browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Login to Site with Public Access
* Logout yourself from the Site/or even Remove the user from Site.
* Login to Atlassian Account.
* Access the Public URL

h3. Expected Results
* User should be able to view the Public Spaces

h3. Actual Results
* Ask to Login

h3. Workaround
* Use Incognito Mode or Logout from Atlassian Account.

*Note*

The affected customer instance is a Confluence only instance.
fields.summary: Public Space asks for login for a former user

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Users not having the space permission can browse the pages on the space if the space is connected with Jira Service Desk as a knowledge base.
For example, there's a use case that both of the following requirements need to be met:

* One knowledge base should be accessible to the invited service desk customers
* One user account should only be able to browse spaces having a space permission

 !01-j.png|thumbnail!  !02-c.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

If the *Customers my team adds to the project* option is selected in the *Customer permissions*, Confluence needs to take into account whether the user is also invited to the project as a customer.

 !03-j.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Users without permission should not be able to browse knowledge base spaces if the Service Desk project is restricted to invited customers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Text is duplicated unexpectedly when multiple users edit the same line on the same page and with Japanese IME.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit the same line on the same page with Japanese IME by multiple users

h3. Expected Results
Only the text typed by user is inserted.

h3. Actual Results
Duplicate text is inserted.

Here’s a video captured the problem.
[https://youtu.be/AxZtvNqMN4o]

This problem occurs both of new editor and old editor.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Text is duplicated unexpectedly when multiple users edit the same line on the same page and with Japanese IME.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User mentions in task show as "Unlicensed user" in Task Report Macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Mention a user in a task
 !スクリーンショット 2019-12-20 13.36.57.png|thumbnail! 
# In another page, insert Task Report macro and include the task made in 1

h3. Expected Results
The mentioned text shows up as expected

h3. Actual Results
The mention is replaced with "Unlicensed User" 
 !スクリーンショット 2019-12-20 13.38.32.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
There are no workarounds found so far, though the user itself can be confirmed in the "Assignee" column
fields.summary: User mentions in task show as "Unlicensed user" in Task Report Macro

fields.description:
It would be great if we could turn the Title in the Excerpt Include into a link back to the original page. 

A simple check box (Use Title as Link to original Page) should suffice and then you turn the Excerpt title into a link.
fields.summary: Allow Link to original page in Excerpt Include

fields.description:
Hello,

I am a new user to the software, but have good experience in other software packages. 

Please could you let me know how to crop an image as in a company of designers none of us can work out how to do this? I have also scoured the internet to no avail.

If this feature is included, I feel it should be more obvious how to do so. If this is something not included I would really like it to be added as it would make laying out much easier.

I also haven't worked out how to get pictures to sit on the same line without using a table.

Kind Regards,

Robert
fields.summary: Cropping Images
